channel.title: Engineering on Duy Do
channel.description: Recent content in Engineering on Duy Do

item.title: Understanding Elasticsearch searching data flow
item.description:
Search is a generic term for information retrieval. Elasticsearch provides various retrieval capabilities, including full-text searches, geo searches, range searches, scripted searches, and aggregations.

How does Elasticsearch execute a search query behind the scenes? The following diagram shows data flow for searching operations.

item.title: Understanding Elasticsearch deleting data flow
item.description: How is a document deleted from Elasticsearch? The following diagram shows data flow behinds the scene of deleting a single document.

item.title: Understanding Elasticsearch indexing data flow
item.description: When a document is stored in Elasticsearch, it is indexed and fully searchable within 1 second. Elasticsearch uses an inverted index data structure that supports full-text searches efficiently and very fast.

item.title: Java: Type Promotion
item.description:
Cách đây cũng khá lâu mình đem đoạn mã đơn giản bên dưới hỏi một số bạn làm Java, cả juniors và seniors, các bạn đều bảo rằng đoạn mã này không có vấn đề, biên dịch và chạy được.

byte b = 1;
b = b * 2;

Thật ra thì đoạn mã trên không thể biên dịch được.

Trước tiên thử phân tích xem vì sao các bạn trả lời như vậy. Nhìn vào đoạn mã thì thấy b được khai báo kiểu byte và gán giá trị 1, khai báo này hoàn toàn hợp lệ vì tầm trị của kiểu byte trong Java từ -128 đến 127.

item.title: EVM - Elasticsearch Version Manager
item.description: As an Elasticsearch consultant, I often work with different versions of Elasticsearch. To make my developer life easier, I created evm. It allows me to install, remove, test multiple versions easily.

item.title: How Elasticsearch cluster works
item.description:
This post is part of a series covering the architecture of Elasticsearch based on my experience while working with it. In this post, we’ll be discussing how the cluster works, try to find answers for following questions:

  • How a node in cluster talks to others?
  • What happens when a node joins or leaves the cluster?
  • What happens when a node stops or has encountered a problem?

item.title: Effective Persistence of Enums in Java: A Deep Dive into Safe and Scalable Design
item.description:
How to persist an enumeration effectively? Here is my experience.

I’ll use Wordpress as an example. We all know that every post in Wordpress blog system has a status with possible values: draft, pending-review, published and so on.
